intro: Uvaria simiarum, commonly known as the monkey fruit or monkey apple, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. The berries are used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some regions.
